org.apache.hadoop.fs

Class FileSystemContractBaseTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystemContractBaseTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public abstract class FileSystemContractBaseTest
extends junit.framework.TestCase

    A collection of tests for the contract of the FileSystem. This test should be used for general-purpose implementations of FileSystem, that is, implementations that provide implementations of all of the functionality of FileSystem.

    To test a given FileSystem implementation create a subclass of this test and override TestCase.setUp() to initialize the fs FileSystem instance variable.

      • testOverWriteAndRead

        public void testOverWriteAndRead()
                          throws Exception
        Verify that if you take an existing file and overwrite it, the new values get picked up. This is a test for the behavior of eventually consistent filesystems.
        Throws:
        Exception - on any failure

      • writeAndRead

        protected void writeAndRead(Path path,
                byte[] src,
                int len,
                boolean overwrite,
                boolean delete)
                     throws IOException
        Write a file and read it in, validating the result. Optional flags control whether file overwrite operations should be enabled, and whether the file should be deleted afterwards. If there is a mismatch between what was written and what was expected, a small range of bytes either side of the first error are logged to aid diagnosing what problem occurred -whether it was a previous file or a corrupting of the current file. This assumes that two sequential runs to the same path use datasets with different character moduli.
        Parameters:
        path - path to write to
        len - length of data
        overwrite - should the create option allow overwrites?
        delete - should the file be deleted afterwards? -with a verification that it worked. Deletion is not attempted if an assertion has failed earlier -it is not in a finally{} block.
        Throws:
        IOException - IO problems

      • toChar

        protected String toChar(byte b)
        Convert a byte to a character for printing. If the byte value is < 32 -and hence unprintable- the byte is returned as a two digit hex value
        Parameters:
        b - byte
        Returns:
        the printable character string

      • dataset

        protected byte[] dataset(int len,
             int base,
             int modulo)
        Create a dataset for use in the tests; all data is in the range base to (base+modulo-1) inclusive
        Parameters:
        len - length of data
        base - base of the data
        modulo - the modulo
        Returns:
        the newly generated dataset
